div.p:
Cohort 360 app is a powerful FHIR search engine and viewer to generate cohorts, extract data, search for patients... The Cohort 360 implementation guide describes Cohort 360 web app FHIR resource usage. It discribes how to modelize the data to work with the app.
This IG defines the profiles used by the Cohort 360 app and the attributes used by the app, marked by Must Supprt (MS) tags.

There are two sets of resources:
Resources used by Cohort360: CohortCondition, CohortDocumentReference, CohortEncounter, CohortGroup, CohortObservation, CohortOrganization, CohortPatient, CohortPractitioner, CohortProcedure and GHM
Resources created by Cohort360 and the DPO portail: PractitionerConsent and RefusedResearchConsent

For now, this ig has a French scope. In the future, new profiles are going to be developed for an international scope. This is why there are some french acronyms:
GHM: Groupe Homogène de Malade
PMSI: Programme de Médicalisation des Systèmes d'information
The goal is to have a cohortIG with a universal scope (arkhn.fhir.uv.cohort360). Country particularities will be defined in sub-ig which inherit from arkhn.fhir.uv.cohort360 (ex: arkhn.fhir.fr.cohort360).
